content.raw: True, we don't know how the robot works and we should clarify it.  But we do know how the underlying physics engines work and how they represent time.  Have you seen a nanosecond timer in ODE, Bullet or DART?  If the engine itself represent time as a single scalar and uses it for numerical integration, we cannot gain resolution by converting it to sec/nsec and pretending that it came from a system timer... I would agree with you if the timestamp was system time rather than simulation time, but I think we already established that it is simulation time.
